_header: There was in Asia in a great city
Title(s): Prioress’s Tale; Alma redemptoris mater; Canterbury Tales
Subjects: pilgrims/pilgrimage; Jews; innocence; Virgin Mary, miracles of
_description: Geoffrey Chaucer, the Prioress’s Tale of the Canterbury Tales — 203 lines in 7-line, rhyme royal stanzas.

BodArcSelB14.First Lines:
Ther was in Assie in a grete citeamonges cristen folke a
                    Iewerye…
BodArcSelB14.Last Lines:
…on vs his grete mercy multipliefor reuerence of his moder
                    Marie Amen
BodArcSelB14.Attributed Title:
the tale (f. 164, margin); the priorasse (RT); Here endith the Priorasse
                    hir tale… (f. 167v)

BodRawC86.First Lines:
Ther was in assye in the grete CiteAmonge crysten folke a
                    Iewrye…
BodRawC86.Last Lines:
…That of this murthir wist and þat anoneEvill shall
                    þey haue þat evill deserue…
BodRawC86.Note:
Chaucer’s Clerk’s Tale (on folios
                        156v-173v; lines IV.57-1200) and Prioress’s
                        Prologue and Tale (incomplete, on folios
                        174v-177v; lines VII.453-632) of the Canterbury
                        Tales. VII.633-690 lost; 511, 565, 568 omitted; 630-1 reversed in the
                        Tale.
